articles.title: India Dominate Tahiti in FIBA Asia Cup Division B
articles.content: India’s women’s basketball team claimed a 78–55 win over Tahiti in the FIBA Asia Cup Division B, courtesy of strong displays by Sreekala Rani (15 pts) and Sathya Krishnamurthi (11 pts), securing second place in their group and moving to a semifinal decider against Thailand after finishing behind Chinese Taipei. The effective bench rotation and defensive steals were key to their success :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
articles.excerpt: 18 steals and 27 turnovers powered India to a 78–55 win over Tahiti, led by Sreekala Rani & Sathya Krishnamurthi.

articles.title: Free Fire MAX India Cup Returns with ₹1 Crore Prize Pool
articles.content: The Free Fire MAX India Cup 2025, Garena’s long-awaited return to India after a 2022 ban, kicks off with a ₹1 crore prize pool. With in-game qualifiers beginning July 13 and 48 teams advancing to the Online Qualifiers (July 26–Aug 3), the tournament is set to proceed through to a grand finale on September 27–28 :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.
articles.excerpt: Garena’s Free Fire MAX India Cup returns with 48 teams and a ₹1 crore prize pool, marking its biggest Indian esports push since 2022.

articles.title: CISF Launches Record 433‑Athlete Sports Recruitment Drive
articles.content: The CISF has announced its largest-ever sports recruitment drive, filling 433 athlete positions—including 229 women—backed by enhanced funding, diet support, and injury management. This comes after their athletes won 66 medals at the 2025 World Police & Fire Games in Birmingham :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.
articles.excerpt: CISF rolls out its biggest sports intake ever (433 athletes) after a strong performance at the 2025 WPFG in Birmingham.

articles.title: Sunil Chhetri Urges Calm Amid ISL Suspension Uncertainty
articles.content: Sunil Chhetri shared deep concern about the indefinite suspension of the 2025–26 ISL season due to pending master-rights agreement renewals. He appealed for calm and unity among stakeholders, expressing hope for a resolution soon :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.
articles.excerpt: Captain Chhetri calls for calm as ISL faces suspension over master‑rights agreement delays.

articles.title: India Women Secure Maiden T20I Series Win in England
articles.content: India’s women’s cricket team clinched their first-ever T20I series win in England, taking the series 3–1. Aided by Radha Yadav’s tight spin (2‑15) and Shafali Verma’s explosive 75 in the fourth game, India sealed the historic victory :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.
articles.excerpt: India’s women made history with their maiden T20I series victory on English soil, sealing the series 3–1.

articles.title: Deepti Sharma’s One‑Handed Six Inspired by Rishabh Pant
articles.content: In the first ODI against England at Southampton, Deepti Sharma struck a majestic one‑handed six—a shot she credited to Rishabh Pant. Her unbeaten 62* helped India chase down 259 and go 1‑0 up in the series :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.
articles.excerpt: Deepti Sharma smashes a one‑handed six, inspired by Rishabh Pant, during her match-winning 62* in Southampton.

articles.title: Shikhar Dhawan to Host 'Beyond the Boundaries' at Lord’s
articles.content: Shikhar Dhawan will return to Lord’s on July 23—not for a match, but as host of ‘Beyond the Boundaries’, a storytelling gala organized by Da One Group, celebrating purpose-driven initiatives tied to Dhawan’s Foundation :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.
articles.excerpt: Dhawan to host an impactful storytelling gala at Lord’s cricket ground on July 23.

articles.title: Prof. Sambhu Prasad Named Official for Indian University Team
articles.content: Prof. Sambhu Prasad, Dean of Physical Education at RGU, has been nominated by AIU as an official for India’s athletics team at the FISU World University Games (July 16–27 in Germany). The delegation includes over 300 student-athletes :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.
articles.excerpt: RGU’s Prof. Sambhu Prasad will serve as team official at the 2025 FISU World University Games in Germany.
